# Contributing to Dairy Management System

Thank you for your interest in contributing to the Dairy Management System!

## Getting Started

1. Fork the repository
2. Clone your fork: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/dairy-management.git`
3. Create a virtual environment: `python -m venv venv`
4. Activate: `source venv/bin/activate` (macOS/Linux) or `venv\Scripts\activate` (Windows)
5. Install dependencies: `pip install -r requirements.txt`
6. Create a new branch: `git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name`

## Development Workflow

1. Make your changes
2. Test locally: `python app_complete.py`
3. Commit with clear messages: `git commit -m "Add feature: description"`
4. Push to your fork: `git push origin feature/your-feature-name`
5. Create a Pull Request with detailed description

## Code Standards

- Follow PEP 8 style guidelines
- Add docstrings to functions and classes
- Test your changes before pushing
- Update README.md if adding new features
- Keep commits atomic and meaningful

## Reporting Issues

Use GitHub Issues to report bugs or suggest features with:
- Clear title and description
- Steps to reproduce (for bugs)
- Expected vs actual behavior
- Your environment details

By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under the MIT License.
